intro: Delphinium tenii, commonly known as the alpine larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features tall, spindly stems with clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. Delphinium tenii is known for its striking floral display and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes other familiar genera such as buttercups and anemones.
